author: BEN NORUM
title: The best restaurants in Brixton
text:
The best restaurants in Brixton 
From jerk chicken to Japanese fusion, here's where to eat in Brixton Wednesday 15 February 2017 15:21 GMT Click to followES Going Out Kricket: One of Brixton's best 
Brixton’s dining scene is among the most dynamic in London, thanks in no small part to the hubs of Brixton Market, Brixton Village and Pop Brixton which have acted as incubator hubs for new foodie businesses. 
Both the Franco Manca and Honest Burger chains started out there and to this day the area maintains a high proportion of indepenent restaurants, despite increasing concern over rising rents. 
Add in the fact that it can boast being one of London’s most multicultural spots, and you have some interesting eating on your hands. 
See the pick of our best restaurants below, listed in alphabetical order and shown on a map. Boqueria 
Roughly halfway between Brixton and Clapham North sits this excellent — and excellent value — tapas bar. Classics such as croquetas and pan con tomate are among the highlights, along with a selection of hams. 
boqueriatapas.com Brixton Village Grill 
Grilled sardines, piri-piri prawns, lamb chops and chargrilled steaks galore are on the menu at this bustling Portuguese-influenced restaurant. It’s smoky, succulent and hard to get a seat. Boqueria Donostia Social Club 
Spanish tapas and pintxos straight out of the Basque country, served in one of Pop Brixton’s shipping containers. Highlights include lamb cutlets and braised Iberico pork cheek as well as cheese and charcuterie selections.
